metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3355 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel's drivers/gpu/drm/msm/msm_gem_submit.c code in the submit_lookup_cmds function, which fails because it lacks a check of the return value of kmalloc(). This issue allows a local user to crash the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3355` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic-64k - 5.15.0-75.82
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1038-aws - 5.15.0-1038.43
No subscription required
